title: White wine grape oversupply 'another kick in the guts' for growers already in crisis | ABC NEWS
description: There are fears farmers in Australia's largest wine grape growing region will be forced to walk off the block as white wine grape prices are expected to drop due to an oversupply this upcoming vintage season. The wine industry across Australia has been battling a global oversupply of red wine grapes due to international market changes and shifting consumer behaviour for the past five years. title: Court hears man accused of student's murder acted in 'chillingly premeditated' way | ABC NEWS
description: A man accused of murdering a 23-year-old student as he slept in his Darwin home acted in a "chillingly premeditated" and "extremely violent way", a jury has heard on the final day of a week-long NT Supreme Court trial.  Brendan Kantilla, 31, has pleaded not guilty to the murder of Bangladeshi man Md Isfaqur Rahman in the Darwin suburb of Millner in May 2023.  Mr Kantilla has pleaded guilty to the alternative charge of manslaughter.  By doing so, he has accepted his actions caused the death of Mr Rahman but denies he intended to cause the death. Olivana Lathouris has this story for ABC News Northern Territory. title: New brain study shows adolescence ends at 32 | ABC NEWS
description: A new study from the University of Cambridge suggests adolescence does not end until the age of 32, with the brain undergoing five major developmental stages throughout life at the ages nine, 32, 66 and 83.  Neuroscientists compared the brains of 3,802 people using MRI scans and found the brain doesn’t follow a single linear trajectory instead, it shifts through distinct phases.   Social version by Tatenda Chibika for the ABC News social media team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Climate activists turn Venice's Grand Canal bright green | ABC NEWS
description: The water in Venice’s Grand Canal was turned bright green on Saturday by Extinction Rebellion activists protesting environmental policies.  According to the group, Greta Thunberg attended the protest, held as the COP30 climate summit drew to a close in Brazil.   “We are symbolically turning waters green because this is the world current climate policies are dragging us toward,”  Extinction Rebellion said in a statement.  The canal has been targeted by environmental activists during previous COP summits.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Man shot dead in Sydney's Blacktown, two arrested | ABC NEWS
description: A man aged in his early 20s has died after being shot multiple times in Blacktown, in western Sydney.    Supt Brendan Gorman from Blacktown Police area command says that at about 11.50am police and emergency services were called to Carinya st, Blacktown, where they found a man with gunshot wounds. Paramedics and police administered first aid, but the man died at the scene.   After a short police pursuit that ended in a crash, police arrested two alleged offenders who are now in custody at Blacktown police station.  Social version by Madeleine Wales for ABC News Social Media Team.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
